resources.string: You can use this app to check your visitors\' coronavirus passes. This way your location can stay open safely.
Visitors first make a QR code of their certificate. With this app, you can check the QR codes and see who is allowed to enter.
Always ask visitors to show their proof of identity. Check whether the details on your screen match the details on their ID document. All good? Then the visitor is allowed to enter.
With this app, you can receive visitors again. But only if your location or activity falls under the designated locations.
The acceptable use policy details how CoronaCheck Scanner uses your data and what your rights are.
Location data are not saved or used
You\'re only allowed to use this data to check the certificate
The visitor\'s data is not centrally stored anywhere
I\'ve read and agree to the acceptable use policy.
Sorry, there was a technical error
Is the QR code valid, and are the details the same as on the proof of identity? Then you can grant the visitor access.
This is an international QR code
This is not a valid certificate in the Netherlands. Ask the visitor to show a Dutch QR code.

The visitor doesn\'t have a valid coronavirus pass.
Read possible causes

A red screen means that the QR code does not meet Dutch requirements.Here\'s what you can do:
  1. Verify if the time is set correctly on the visitor\'s phone and yours. Make sure to set the date and time to ‘set automatically’.
  2. Verify if the visitor is showing an original certificate. A screenshot of a certificate may cause problems.
  3. Ask the visitor to completely shut down the app and restart it. Please scan the QR code again after.

Still looking at a red screen?
Please ask the visitor to contact the CoronaCheck help desk.Please note: Without a green screen with check mark, you can\'t grant the visitor access.
This QR code does not contain a coronavirus pass
Ask the visitor to show a QR code of a coronavirus pass.
Ask for a Dutch QR code
You have scanned an international QR code. In the Netherlands, CoronaCheck users should show their Dutch QR code.

You cannot grant the visitor access if the details on your screen are different from those on the identity document.

Please note: sometimes not all details are shown
This is done to protect the visitor\'s privacy. You will see a hyphen (-) in the field. In this case, verify only the details you\'re seeing.

CoronaCheck Scanner is created so that certain locations and activities can open their doors again. Think for example of football matches and concerts. Visitors create a coronavirus pass of a vaccination, a negative test result or if they\'ve had corona and are recovered. With this app, only visitors with a coronavirus pass gain access. This way, the Netherlands can head out more often.
Use your phone\'s camera to scan visitors\' QR codes, in the CoronaCheck app or on paper. Tourists can show their QR code in a foreign app or on paper.
For visitors aged 14 and over, always check if the details on your screen are the same as on the visitor\'s proof of identity. This way, you can ensure the QR code belongs to the visitor.
Sometimes not all details are shown
Sometimes not all details are shown
Details can be left out to protect the visitor\'s privacy. You will see a hyphen (-) instead. In this case, only check the details that are visible.
Person is holding a phone with a red screen and a black cross.
Does your screen turn green and show a checkmark? In that case, the QR code is valid and the details are the same as on the proof of identity. You can grant the visitor access.
Scanner wants to access your camera
So the app can scan QR codes
Prefer laser scanning?\n\nUse the yellow buttons on your device.
Prefer the barcode scanner?\nUse the scan buttons on your device.
The app is not in use at the moment. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl
To continue, install the latest version of the app.
You\'re not connected to the internet
You need to be connected to start the app.
There\'s a new version of the app available.

Here\'s what changed
br/>
  • Description of acceptable use policy
  • App usage explanation
  • Camera usage permission
Read the full acceptable use policy here.
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You don\'t have access to the CoronaCheck Scanner app if you don\'t agree to the updated policy.
What should I pay attention to?
Please note: ID check is mandatory
Check your phone\'s time settings. They might be incorrect.

In order to properly use the CoronaCheck Scanner app, it is important that the time on your phone is set correctly. For example, if the clock on your phone is a few minutes ahead, an error might occur while verifying a coronavirus pass.

Go to your phone\'s settings and set Date & Time to \'set automatically\'.
Does your screen turn red and show a cross? In that case, you\'ll receive information to assist the visitor. If the screen stays red, you cannot grant the visitor access.
